name: Skip Room
description:
Fight your way through a fortress to reach the end. You aren't sure if you will find what you are hoping to find at the end, but surely you're doing it for a reason other than sheer carnage... right?

It may take a time or two to complete the game, but a full run should take about 10 minutes or less.

Simple little game I've built to collect everything I've learned building Unity game prototypes and custom systems into one relatively complete game. There are still a number of things I could add to make it feel more polished, but I know if I start working towards that, I'll never finish it. :)

The music volume of the Main Menu can be used to judge the volume of the game. It *should* not be any louder than the main menu music. 

Let me know if you run into any issues while playing the game and I'll look into it! Thank you!

Current Issues

  • Double Pause menu with fullscreen web player - Having trouble reproducing
  • Scaling issues in web player (Health UI)
  • Zoom Level in Web Player is too close

Credits to assets used:

  • Art Asset - Minifantasy - Dungeon
    • https://krishna-palacio.itch.io/minifantasy-dungeon
  • Audio
    • https://www.gamedevmarket.net/asset/rpg-game-chiptune-soundtrack-bundle-1560/
    • https://jdbartist.itch.io/
